summary: An internal FBI email from the New York Field Office scheduling a status meeting regarding the Epstein case. It requests updates on victim interviews, victim totals, and the status of evidence reviews (CART and taint evidence) for coordination with SDNY.

persons.name: ADIC
persons.role: Assistant Director in Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: The recipient of the scheduled status meeting regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: The author/sender of the email, leading the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in FBI New York.

connections.description: The SSA is scheduling and preparing a status update meeting for the ADIC regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Epstein Case Status Meeting
events.description: A scheduled meeting between FBI New York's SSA of Squad C-20 and the ADIC to discuss the status of the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) in New York was actively managing the Epstein investigation as of September 2019.
The investigation involved tracking victim interviews and maintaining a spreadsheet with every victim's name.
Two parallel evidence reviews were underway: a 'CART review (non-taint)' and a 'taint evidence review' being coordinated with the SDNY (Southern District of New York).
The email indicates ongoing, high-level coordination within the FBI and with federal prosecutors regarding evidence handling in the case.
